14    to visualize or imagine  
15    to describe or depict, esp. vividly  
16    often passive   to put in a picture or make a picture of  
they were pictured sitting on the rocks     
     (C15: from Latin pictura painting, from pingere to paint)  
living picture  
      n      another term for     →   tableau vivant  
motion picture  
      n      a U.S. and Canadian term for     →   film     →   1  
moving picture  
      n      a U.S. and Canadian name for     →   film     →   1  
picture card  
      n      another name for     →   court card  
picture hat  
      n   a decorated hat with a very wide brim, esp. as worn by women in paintings by Gainsborough and Reynolds  
picture house  
      n     (Chiefly Brit)      an old-fashioned name for     →   cinema     →   1a  
picture moulding  
      n  
1    the edge around a framed picture  
2      (Also called)    picture rail   the moulding or rail near the top of a wall from which pictures can be hung  
picture palace  
      n     (Brit)      an old-fashioned name for     →   cinema     →   1a  
picture tube  
      n      another name for     →   television tube  
picture window  
      n   a large window having a single pane of glass, usually placed so that it overlooks a view  
picture writing  
1    any writing system that uses pictographs  
2    a system of artistic expression and communication using pictures or symbolic figures

The Ultimate Picture Palace
Jeune Street | Cowley Road, Oxford OX4 1BN, England
+44 1865 245288
More attraction details
Attraction details
Owner description: Independent cinema screening a diverse mix of mainstream, independent, foreign, classic and cult films
There are newer reviews for this attraction
“old fashioned cinema”
Reviewed 12 March 2012
This art cinema shows some quirky, uncommon European films in addition to the mainstream stuff. the seating is not so comfy, and the place does not feel especially clean (it is an old place) but the staff are friendly, refreshments are served including coffee, cake, and a selection of bottled beer, cider, wine... really a neat place. membership pays for itself if you intend seeing just 3 films, break even at 2 films! Hard work to make a success of this cinema in a listed building - highly recommended.
Helpful?

Definition of picture palace in English:
picture palace
A cinema.
Example sentences
‘This was a fascinating journey tracing the history of cinema, from humble beginnings in small local halls to the splendid picture palaces that graced almost every High Street in the land.’
‘Eventually, however, the picture palaces began to lose their pulling power and bingo started taking over.’
‘Although he has lived in Australia for 30 years, he will never forget his trips to the picture palace.’
‘Such disregard for the traditions of the picture palace was hard to take.’
‘Tonight's unique fireworks display, reflected against the wall of the old building, will be the highlight of a grand goodbye to what was once the town's most splendid picture palace.’
